markdown.markdown:
```{r} #| label: set-up #| include: false source("R/globals.R") load(file = "data/clean_survey.Rdata") load(file = "data/raked_survey.Rdata") ``` ```{r} #| label: maths-scheduling-approach survey_data_raked |> drop_na(Q24) |> group_by(Q24) |> summarise(pct = survey_mean(vartype = "ci", level = 0.9, na.rm = T)) |> drop_na() |> arrange(-pct) |> mutate(across(starts_with("pct"), ~percent(.x, 0.1))) |> kable(align = "lrrr", col.names = c("Approach to scheduling maths", "%", "90% CI (lower)", "90% CI (upper)")) ``` ```{r} #| label: hours_of_maths hours_taught_df <- survey_data_raked |> mutate(hours_taught = coalesce(clean_survey$Q25, clean_survey$Q26)) |> drop_na(hours_taught) |> group_by(hours_taught) |> summarise(pct = survey_mean(na.rm = T, vartype = "ci", level = 0.9), n = n()) |> drop_na(hours_taught) |> mutate(n = sum(n), hours_taught = str_extract(hours_taught, "\\d+\\.?\\d*"), hours_taught = if_else(row_number() == 1, ">10", if_else(row_number() == n(), "<2", as.character(hours_taught)))) |> slice(c(n(), 2:(n() - 1), 1)) |> mutate(hours_taught = factor(hours_taught, hours_taught)) hours_taught_df |> ggplot(aes(x = hours_taught, y = pct, ymax = pct_upp, ymin = pct_low)) + geom_col() + geom_errorbar(color = "black", width = .2) + # theme and labels theme_grattan(base_size = 14) + grattan_colour_manual() + grattan_fill_manual() + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Most schools teach between 4 and 5 hours of maths a week", subtitle = "Percentage of teachers and principals who selected each response (with 90% confidence intervals)", x = "Timetabled hours of maths per week", y = NULL, caption = glue("Note: Total number of responses is {min(hours_taught_df$n) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) ``` ## School practices ```{r} #| label: school_practices #| fig.height: 11 school_practice_labels <- clean_survey |> select(starts_with("Q27")) |> var_labels() |> get_label() |> str_replace_all(c("school_practices - " = "", "\\s*\\([^\\)]+\\)" = "")) school_practice_df <- survey_data_raked |> select(starts_with(c("Q27"))) |> mutate(across(starts_with("Q27"), ~ case_when( . == "Agree" ~ T, . == "Strongly agree" ~ T, is.na(.) ~ NA, .default = F ))) school_practice_df <- school_practice_df |> summarise(across(everything(), list(pct = ~survey_mean(.x, na.rm = T, vartype = "ci", level = 0.9), n = ~sum(!is.na(.x))) ) ) |> pivot_longer( cols = everything(), names_to = c("question", ".value"), names_pattern = "(Q27_\\d+)_(.+)" ) |> mutate(label = school_practice_labels) school_practice_df |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)) |> fct_reorder(pct), y = pct, ymin = pct_low, ymax = pct_upp)) + geom_col() + geom_errorbar(color = grattan_black, width = .2) + coord_flip() + # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14) + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Many schools do not yet have a systematic approach to maths instruction in place", subtitle = "Percent of teachers who agree or strongly agree (with 90 per cent confidence interval)", x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements varied by statement between {min(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()} and {max(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) # Version for Project Preview school_practice_df |> tail(5) |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)) |> fct_reorder(pct), y = pct, ymin = pct_low, ymax = pct_upp)) + geom_col() + geom_errorbar(color = grattan_black, width = .2) + coord_flip() + # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14) + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Many schools do not yet have a systematic approach to maths instruction in place", subtitle = "Percent of teachers who agree or strongly agree (with 90 per cent confidence interval)", x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements varied by statement between {min(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()} and {max(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) ``` We can see how these results differ by ses ```{r} #| label: school_practices_ses #| fig.height: 11 school_practices_by_ses <- survey_data_raked |> select(starts_with(c("ses", "Q27"))) |> mutate(across(starts_with("Q27"), ~ case_when( . == "Agree" ~ T, . == "Strongly agree" ~ T, is.na(.) ~ NA, .default = F ))) |> mutate(ses = factor(ses, levels = c( "Mostly disadvantaged", "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students", "Mostly advantaged") )) # Playing around with statistical tests # svyranktest(Q27_1 ~ ses, survey_data_raked, na.rm = T, test= "KruskalWallis") # # svychisq(~Q27_1 + ses, school_practices_by_ses) # # model <- svyglm(Q27_1~ses, school_practice_df) # summary(model) # Simple two-sample t-tests # Will need to soft-code and automate this # survey::svyttest(Q27_1 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # Significant # survey::svyttest(Q27_2 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # survey::svyttest(Q27_3 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses,ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # survey::svyttest(Q27_4 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # survey::svyttest(Q27_5 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # survey::svyttest(Q27_6 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # Significant # survey::svyttest(Q27_7 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # Significant school_practices_by_ses_df <- school_practices_by_ses |> group_by(ses) |> summarise(across(starts_with("Q27"), list(pct = ~survey_mean(.x, na.rm = T, vartype = "ci", level = 0.9), n = ~sum(!is.na(.x))) ) ) |> pivot_longer( cols = !ses, names_to = c("question", ".value"), names_pattern = "(Q27_\\d+)_(.+)" ) |> drop_na() |> mutate(label = rep(school_practice_labels, 3), significant = rep(c("*", "", "", "", "", "*", "*"), 3), label = paste0(label, significant)) school_practices_by_ses_df |> filter(!str_detect(label, "values|mapped")) |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)) |> fct_reorder(pct), y = pct, ymin = pct_low, ymax = pct_upp, fill = fct_rev(ses), )) + geom_col(position = "dodge") + geom_errorbar(color = grattan_black, width = .2, position = position_dodge(0.9)) + coord_flip() + # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14) + theme(plot.subtitle = ggtext::element_markdown()) + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent, expand_top = 0.4) + # geom_richlegend(aes(label = ses, color = ses), legend.position = "bottomright", vjust = 0) + labs(title = "Challenges exist in all schools, but especially in disadvantaged schools", subtitle = glue("Percent of teachers who agree or strongly agree (with 90 per cent confidence interval)
in schools with {colour_text(grattan_red, 'mostly disadvantaged')}, {colour_text(grattan_orange, 'an even mix')}, or {colour_text(grattan_yellow, 'mostly advantaged')} students"), x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements by group were at least {school_practices_by_ses_df |> group_by(ses) |> summarise(min = min(n)) |> pull(min) |> paste(collapse = ', ')} respectively. Statements marked with an asterisk mean that there was a significant difference\n(at the 90 per cent confidence interval) between the porportion of teachers in disavantaged and advantaged schools who agreed or strongly agreed with the statement.\n{source_caption}")) ``` ## Perceptions of colleagues' content knowledge ```{r} #| label: teacher-confidence #| fig.height: 8 teacher_knowledge_labels <- clean_survey |> select(starts_with("Q28")) |> var_labels() |> get_label() |> str_replace_all(c("teachers_subject_knowledge - " = "", "\\s*\\([^\\)]+\\)" = "")) teacher_knowledge_df <- clean_survey |> select(starts_with("Q28")) |> pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = "question", values_to = "response") |> drop_na(response) |> group_by(question, response) |> summarise(n = n()) |> group_by(question) |> mutate(prop = n/sum(n), sample_size = sum(n)) |> ungroup() |> mutate(label = rep(teacher_knowledge_labels, each = 5), response = factor( response, levels = c( "No teacher", "Some teachers", "About half of teachers", "Most teachers", "All teachers" ))) teacher_knowledge_df |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)), y = prop, fill = fct_rev(response))) + geom_col() + coord_flip() + # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14, legend = "bottom") + theme(legend.location = "plot") + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + guides(fill = guide_legend(reverse = TRUE)) + labs(title = "Many teachers feel that fewer than half of their colleagues could teach Year 6 maths", subtitle = "Percent of teachers who gave each response", x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements varied by statement between {min(teacher_knowledge_df$sample_size) |> comma()} and {max(teacher_knowledge_df$sample_size) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) ```

```{r} #| label: set-up #| include: false source("R/globals.R") load(file = "data/clean_survey.Rdata") load(file = "data/raked_survey.Rdata") ``` ## How do schools schedule maths? ```{r} #| label: maths-scheduling-approach survey_data_raked |> drop_na(Q24) |> group_by(Q24) |> summarise(pct = survey_mean(vartype = "ci", level = 0.9, na.rm = T)) |> drop_na() |> arrange(-pct) |> mutate(across(starts_with("pct"), ~percent(.x, 0.1))) |> kable(align = "lrrr", col.names = c("Approach to scheduling maths", "%", "90% CI (lower)", "90% CI (upper)")) ``` ```{r} #| label: hours_of_maths hours_taught_df <- survey_data_raked |> mutate(hours_taught = coalesce(clean_survey$Q25, clean_survey$Q26)) |> drop_na(hours_taught) |> group_by(hours_taught) |> summarise(pct = survey_mean(na.rm = T, vartype = "ci", level = 0.9), n = n()) |> drop_na(hours_taught) |> mutate(n = sum(n), hours_taught = str_extract(hours_taught, "\\d+\\.?\\d*"), hours_taught = if_else(row_number() == 1, ">10", if_else(row_number() == n(), "<2", as.character(hours_taught)))) |> slice(c(n(), 2:(n() - 1), 1)) |> mutate(hours_taught = factor(hours_taught, hours_taught)) hours_taught_df |> ggplot(aes(x = hours_taught, y = pct, ymax = pct_upp, ymin = pct_low)) + geom_col() + geom_errorbar(color = "black", width = .2) + # theme and labels theme_grattan(base_size = 14) + grattan_colour_manual() + grattan_fill_manual() + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Most schools teach between 4 and 5 hours of maths a week", subtitle = "Percentage of teachers and principals who selected each response (with 90% confidence intervals)", x = "Timetabled hours of maths per week", y = NULL, caption = glue("Note: Total number of responses is {min(hours_taught_df$n) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) ``` ## School practices ```{r} #| label: school_practices #| fig.height: 11 school_practice_labels <- clean_survey |> select(starts_with("Q27")) |> var_labels() |> get_label() |> str_replace_all(c("school_practices - " = "", "\\s*\\([^\\)]+\\)" = "")) school_practice_df <- survey_data_raked |> select(starts_with(c("Q27"))) |> mutate(across(starts_with("Q27"), ~ case_when( . == "Agree" ~ T, . == "Strongly agree" ~ T, is.na(.) ~ NA, .default = F ))) school_practice_df <- school_practice_df |> summarise(across(everything(), list(pct = ~survey_mean(.x, na.rm = T, vartype = "ci", level = 0.9), n = ~sum(!is.na(.x))) ) ) |> pivot_longer( cols = everything(), names_to = c("question", ".value"), names_pattern = "(Q27_\\d+)_(.+)" ) |> mutate(label = school_practice_labels) school_practice_df |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)) |> fct_reorder(pct), y = pct, ymin = pct_low, ymax = pct_upp)) + geom_col() + geom_errorbar(color = grattan_black, width = .2) + coord_flip() + # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14) + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Many schools do not yet have a systematic approach to maths instruction in place", subtitle = "Percent of teachers who agree or strongly agree (with 90 per cent confidence interval)", x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements varied by statement between {min(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()} and {max(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14) + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Many schools do not yet have a systematic approach to maths instruction in place", subtitle = "Percent of teachers who agree or strongly agree (with 90 per cent confidence interval)", x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements varied by statement between {min(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()} and {max(school_practice_df$n) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) ``` We can see how these results differ by ses ```{r} #| label: school_practices_ses #| fig.height: 11 school_practices_by_ses <- survey_data_raked |> select(starts_with(c("ses", "Q27"))) |> mutate(across(starts_with("Q27"), ~ case_when( . == "Agree" ~ T, . == "Strongly agree" ~ T, is.na(.) ~ NA, .default = F ))) |> mutate(ses = factor(ses, levels = c( "Mostly disadvantaged", "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students", "Mostly advantaged") )) # survey::svyttest(Q27_6 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # Significant # survey::svyttest(Q27_7 ~ ses=="Mostly advantaged", subset(school_practices_by_ses, ses != "A fairly even mix of advantaged and disadvantaged students")) # Significant school_practices_by_ses_df <- school_practices_by_ses |> group_by(ses) |> summarise(across(starts_with("Q27"), list(pct = ~survey_mean(.x, na.rm = T, vartype = "ci", level = 0.9), n = ~sum(!is.na(.x))) ) ) |> pivot_longer( cols = !ses, names_to = c("question", ".value"), names_pattern = "(Q27_\\d+)_(.+)" ) |> drop_na() |> mutate(label = rep(school_practice_labels, 3), significant = rep(c("*", "", "", "", "", "*", "*"), 3), label = paste0(label, significant)) school_practices_by_ses_df |> filter(!str_detect(label, "values|mapped")) |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)) |> fct_reorder(pct), y = pct, ymin = pct_low, ymax = pct_upp, fill = fct_rev(ses), )) + geom_col(position = "dodge") + geom_errorbar(color = grattan_black, width = .2, position = position_dodge(0.9)) + coord_flip() + # in schools with {colour_text(grattan_red, 'mostly disadvantaged')}, {colour_text(grattan_orange, 'an even mix')}, or {colour_text(grattan_yellow, 'mostly advantaged')} students"), x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements by group were at least {school_practices_by_ses_df |> group_by(ses) |> summarise(min = min(n)) |> pull(min) |> paste(collapse = ', ')} respectively. Statements marked with an asterisk mean that there was a significant difference\n(at the 90 per cent confidence interval) between the porportion of teachers in disavantaged and advantaged schools who agreed or strongly agreed with the statement.\n{source_caption}")) ``` ## Perceptions of colleagues' content knowledge ```{r} #| label: teacher-confidence #| fig.height: 8 teacher_knowledge_labels <- clean_survey |> select(starts_with("Q28")) |> var_labels() |> get_label() |> str_replace_all(c("teachers_subject_knowledge - " = "", "\\s*\\([^\\)]+\\)" = "")) teacher_knowledge_df <- clean_survey |> select(starts_with("Q28")) |> pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = "question", values_to = "response") |> drop_na(response) |> group_by(question, response) |> summarise(n = n()) |> group_by(question) |> mutate(prop = n/sum(n), sample_size = sum(n)) |> ungroup() |> mutate(label = rep(teacher_knowledge_labels, each = 5), response = factor( response, levels = c( "No teacher", "Some teachers", "About half of teachers", "Most teachers", "All teachers" ))) teacher_knowledge_df |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(str_wrap(label, 40)), y = prop, fill = fct_rev(response))) + geom_col() + coord_flip() + # theme and labels theme_grattan(flipped = T, base_size = 14, legend = "bottom") + theme(legend.location = "plot") + grattan_y_continuous(labels = percent) + guides(fill = guide_legend(reverse = TRUE)) + labs(title = "Many teachers feel that fewer than half of their colleagues could teach Year 6 maths", subtitle = "Percent of teachers who gave each response", x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = glue("Notes: Total responses to statements varied by statement between {min(teacher_knowledge_df$sample_size) |> comma()} and {max(teacher_knowledge_df$sample_size) |> comma()}. {source_caption}")) ```

language.appendix-attribution-cite-as: For attribution, please cite this work as:
